Detailed Description

The class provides methods to manage the calllogs in the CallLog.

The CallLog contains all data about calls.

The following example demonstrates how to use this CallLog class.

 createCallLog(){
     Context context(this);// "this" is mean page instance
     CallLog*  callLog = new CallLog(context);
     //or
     CallLog   callLog(context);
 }

 insertNewCall() {
     ContentValues cv;
     cv.addValue(Calls::NAME(), String("Andy"));
     cv.addValue(Calls::NUMBER(), String("0988123456"));
     cv.addValue(Calls::TYPE(), Calls::Type::INCOMMING_TYPE);
     cv.addValue(Calls::DATE(), System::currentTimeMillis());
     cv.addValue(Calls::DURATION(), 30);
     Uri newCallUri = callLog.add(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(), cv);
 }

 qeueryCallLogs1() {
     StringArray select(4);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::NAME(), 0);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::NUMBER(), 1);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::TYPE(), 2);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::DATE(), 3);
     Cursor* calls = callLog.getN(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(),
                                  &select,
                                  NULL,
                                  NULL,
                                  &Calls::DEFAULT_SORT_ORDER());
 }

 deleteCallLogs() {
     StringArray whereArgs(1);
     whereArgs.replaceAt(2, 0);
     int32_t effect = callLog.remove(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(),
                                     &(Calls::_ID() + "=?"), &whereArgs);

     int32_t effect = callLog.remove(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(),
                                     &(Calls::_ID() + "=2"), NULL);
 }

 updateCallLogs() {
     ContentValues cv;
     cv.addValue(Calls::NAME(), String("Bill"));
     cv.addValue(Calls::NUMBER(), String("0911222333"));

     StringArray whereArgs(1);
     whereArgs.replaceAt(2, 0);
     int32_t effect = callLog.set(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(),
                                  cv,
                                  &(Calls::_ID() + "=?"),
                                  &whereArgs);

     int32_t effect = callLog.set(CallLog::Uri::CALLLOG_CONTENT_URI(),
                                  cv,
                                  &(Calls::_ID() + "=2"),
                                  NULL;
 }

 getCallLogs2(){
     StringArray select(4);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::NAME(), 0);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::NUMBER(), 1);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::TYPE(), 2);
     select.replaceAt(Calls::DATE(), 3);

     Cursor* calls = callLog.getAllCallN(&select);
 }

 getCallLogsByPhone(){
     Cursor* calls = callLog.getCallByPhoneN(&String("0911222333"));
     //or
     Cursor* calls = callLog.getCallByPhoneN(&String("0911222333"), &select);
 }

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::CallLog::getAllCallN ( const base::StringArray *  selection)

Get all call logs.

Parameters:
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing NULL will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
Returns:
A Cursor pointer, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::CallLog::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing NULL will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing NULL will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor pointer, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

CallLog& gaia::content::CallLog::operator= ( const CallLog &  o) [private]
int32_t gaia::content::CallLog::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
int32_t gaia::content::CallLog::set ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const ContentValues &  value,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Update rows into the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
valueThe datas need to update.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To update all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
